title: Which country did the Germans respect the most during both the World Wars? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am going to second the answer of Torax Muller with regard to the German respect for the British. I translated (from Yiddish) the memoir of a Jewish soldier in the Russian Army in the First World War who was interned for the last year of the war in a camp whose location I can only transliterate as Tschersk. He describes (here translated in a mixture of English and Yiddish) the attitude of the Germans to their Russian, English and Italian prisoners. He begins with the Russians, who owed their low status partly to the fact that since the Revolution, they had no recognized governemntal authority to stand up for their rights: “…So they existed in a kind of legal vacuum, with no system of rules to protect them...kéin gesetz, kéin shum internatsionaler âb-mach, wâs soll beschützen séiere recht. They were accordingly burdened with kol aveydes-perekh. Everyone took advantage of them. And for their part, hâben sée nebbekh geschwiggen un gefolgt (obeyed). Even they looked upon themselves, wie sée wollten takkeh gehört zu a niederign klass menschen. And so, like true slaves, they resigned themselves to their bitter fate. “The English prisoners, on the other hand, hâben dâ gelebt wie sée wollten sich gefunnen bei séier taten in wein-gârten! They were better dressed, réiner un zichtiger. They were not dependent only (blõs) auf'n misernem bissel speis vun der allgeméiner lager-küch...instead, they received zu-geschickten speis vun der héim, as well as special packages vun'm Rõtn Kreutz. They stuck together, ver-éinigt unter an éigener ordnung. “They knew all their rights according to international law. If the camp administration tried to deprive them of something, welchen es is punkt in'm "Internatsionalen Âb-mach far Gefangene", hâben sée bald protestiert un gefo’dert séier recht. Hât men takkeh var sée i derekh eretz gehat, i moyreh gehat. If a German soldier, a land-sturmist, had to stand watch over the English barracks, is er bald verwandelt geworen in gâr an ander menschen. Er hât sich bazõgen (conducted himself) zu sée mit tolerantz un respekt. “These English m'yukhusim, even in their captivity, had their own slaves, über welche sée hâben aus-ge’übt séier memsholah (exercised their authority). These were none other than unsere biedne, Russische gefangene. For a bit of soup mit die zhabkehs, or a piece of ferdn-fléisch, which they themselves were above eating...or even a piece of bread with ground-up straw, or for a puff on a cigarette, which the English were only too willing to share...hâben unsere Russische gekehrt un geréinigt séiere barracken, gewaschen séiere wäsch un geputzt (polished) séiere schühech. “Even worse off than the Russians were the Italians, who lived under the most miserable conditions. If the Russians were at least regarded by the Germans as a nutzlechen (useful) element, far "arbetsame kerlen", hâben die selbe Deutschen gekuckt auf die Italiaener wie auf werim (vermin). “This was partly on account of the fact, wâs Italieh hât in der letzter minut ver-raten (betrayed) dem drei-bund zwischen Deutschland, Östreich-Ungarn un Italia. Furthermore, as a group they projected an image of dejection and slovenliness; sée hâben gemacht auf itlechen a schweren eindrück. The harsh climate, zu wâs sée seinen nischt gewe’en zu-gewöhnt (accustomed), with its cold damp winds, which blew in from the neighboring Baltic Sea...all these things took a heavy toll on their health. Hât takkeh der Malakh Ha-Maves (Angel of Death) gekossiert séiere reien (their ranks) auf recht un auf links…”  From the autobiography of Falik Zolf, “On Foreign Soil” .

The British in both. In WWI they did not expect the British to join the war and the Kaiser Wilhem II was very fond and blood related to the Monarch of Great Britain. During WWII Hitler never wanted to invade Great Britain. He never even wanted to dicuss any plans and considered them honorable Aryans. The greatest Motivation Hitler had for Operation Barbarossa ( Invasion of USSR ) was to “scare” the British into peacetalks. Hitler also tried to negotiate a peace after every successful invasion. After Poland, after France, after the Balkan invaision, after invading Scandinavia. Funny thing, even though the Germans and their leaders were very fond of the British, the British were never fond of Germans.War Propaganda in WWI on British side was so effective, that the average British soldier thought that Germans ate babies, cut off breasts of women et cetera.And in WWII Churchill never wanted to surrender to Germany and urged the British to win at all cost. Even Queen Elizabeth helped the war effort by repairing vehicles. No British even thought of surrendering to Nazi Germany.
